page.title: 20St.Michael's Church Dumfries
page.content: St.Michael's Church is a Presbyterian church, named after the patron saint of Dumfries. In fact Robert Burns even came to this church. The ministers who work there are called John Pagaan and Albert Elder. A lady called Miss Mary Smith keeps the church in order. The pulpit in the church is shaped like a chalice and it cost six pounds to build. There have also been a lot of break-ins. During the last war the Norwegians came to Dumfries, and each Sunday they went to St.Michael's Church. And when the war finished and they left, just to show how grateful they were they left a plaque with the words: {When the Germans invaded our country {We Norwegians found in Scotland a home {And in this house of God, {Peace and Strength.
